Articles.Content:
Dear Santa!

As the title says, it would be comfortable to add this feature for switching in/out KSP without that "Fullscreen-Wobbeling" everybody knows.

Greetings

Aesculab

Create a shortcut to KSP.exe.

Right click on it, open Properties.

Go to the first text input (Target), put a space after the last quote mark, and type -popupwindow. It will remove the title bar. Now, run the game in windowed mode. While your English skills require some honing, I think I understood what you wanted and this provides the answer.
The launcher also has this as an option.

easy enough - it's a Unity feature.

find your KSP shortcut icon on the desktop, or make yourself one if you don't have it - right-click it and go to properties.

on the "target" box, go to the end of the line, after it says .../KSP.exe", give it a space after the quote and add:

-popupwindow

apply - close - and fire it up. that's all there is to it

edit:

just noticed i was jinja'd by Wampa up there...

oh well - can't win 'em all

Edited December 14, 2013 by Moach
why so many typo's!?

As a note, if you're using Steam, you can achieve the same by opening the game's Properties dialog and clicking Set Launch Options, then typing -popupwindow into the box. The option in the launcher is called "Fake full-screen" and is in the advanced settings section.
